warnings.selectTooltip: Select preferred video for media hotkeys. Useful if you want to control background music from a different tab (or from another program with global hotkeys).
warnings.sliderTooltip: Hold shift key for precise control.

token.pinTooltip: Pin if you want the current tab to have it's own context (speed, filters, etc).
token.queryTooltip: CSS selector used to find elements to filter. For example, 'video, img' will select both videos and images. For advanced usage, view documentation online about CSS selectors.
token.blockEventsTooltip: Will try to block event propagation and default behaviors.

placer.windowPrompt: Adjust this window's size and location and press Apply.

command.nothingTooltip: It does nothing. It can be used to block shortcut keys. For example, if you keep accidently pressing spacebar, you can set spacebar to do nothing. With this shortcut, you can also configure a delay. This is useful because you can set multiple shortcuts to be triggered by same key and they will run sequentially. For example, invert page with filter, wait 5 seconds, and then reset filters.
command.loopTooltip: Repeat the video from the marked position to the current position.
command.autoBreakTooltip: Break loop if you navigate outside the bounds.
command.autoBreakTooltipAlt: Break skip if you navigate inside it.
command.intoPopupTooltip: Turn current tab into a popup window.
command.skipTooltip: Skip a segment of the video between the marked position and current position.
command.cinemaTooltip: Darken the background of the video. To exit out, press on the background or use shortcut again.
command.toggleSpeedTooltip: Toggle between shortcut speed and the last speed.
command.alwaysOnTooltip: By default, the shortcut can only reactivate the extension if it was last disabled using the same shortcut. Enable this setting to ensure the shortcut always works for enabling the extension, even if it was turned off via the UI menu.

flags.showBadgeTooltip: The badge is the text on the extension icon.
flags.showIndicatorTooltip: The indicator is visual feedback when using shortcuts.
flags.ghostModeTooltip: Try to block website from changing speed. Disabled by default because it might break some websites.
flags.pinByDefaultTooltip: New tabs will automatically be pinned.
flags.customContextTooltip: Saved a snapshot of this tab's current context. Newly created tabs will use this snapshot as an initial state.
flags.jsShortcutWarning: JavaScript shortcuts are currently disabled due to depreciation of older APIs. Functionality will resume when Chromium implements the userScripts.execute() method.
flags.jsRuleWarning: Please update Chrome to support Javascript URL rules.
flags.jsRuleWarningAlt: Please enable developer mode to use javascript features.
flags.keyboardInputTooltip: Consider switching to Virtual input mode if using a virtual keyboard or a non-QWERTY layout keyboard. This only applies to future shortcut changes and existing shortcuts won't be affected.
flags.grantPermissionTooltip: To enable full functionality, including embed video support, this permission must be enabled. For limited functionality, you can enable on a site-by-site basis by right clicking the toolbar icon.

widget.optionTooltip:
(Experimental) A circle widget will be shown while videos are visible.
 - Drag left/right to seek through video.
 - Drag up/down to adjust playback rate.
widget.movementMobile: - Press circle for a few seconds to to move or delete it.
widget.movementDesktop: - With right mouse button, drag circle to move or delete it.
widget.showIconTooltip: Show an icon on the main menu to conveniently toggle the circle widget.
widget.fullscreenOnlyTooltip: Only show widget when the video is fullscreen.

editor.toggleMode: You can use local or global shortcut keys.
editor.toggleModeTooltip: Global shortcuts are useful when you want to control video or audio while using another program.
editor.triggerModeTooltip:
Local shortcuts (default): Flexible shortcut keys.

Global shortcuts: Useful when you want to control video or audio while using another application.

Context menu: Ideal for seldomly used commands. Right click on the page to trigger them.
editor.triggerModeTooltipFf:
Local shortcuts (default): Flexible shortcut keys.

Context menu: Ideal for seldomly used commands. Right click on the page to trigger them.
editor.reversibleTooltip: Allows setting a second shortcut to reverse the list.
editor.wraparoundTooltip: If you go past the start or end, it loops around to the other side.
editor.liveScrubbingTooltip: Continously preview changes while moving cursor.
editor.pressAndHoldTooltip: If enabled, the key must be held down while interactively adjusting the value.

rules.status: URL rules have changed some values.
rules.strictnessTooltip:
Control how frequently the URL rule is applied. 
1: Apply only once until no longer matching.
2: Re-apply if domain name is different.
3: Re-apply every page load.
4: Re-apply every time URL changes.

pageDraw.tips:
Some useful shortcuts
1. Erase with right mouse button.
2. Draw lines with shift click.
3. Toggle between $1 and $2 mode using Caps Lock
4. To adjust eraser size: hold down the middle mouse button and drag left or right.
5. To adjust brush size: hold down the middle mouse button and drag up or down.
6. Flood page with a color by right clicking on the color.
7. Change background color by triple clicking on the color.
